bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick L. Hoffman, December 16, 1928

div1.p: Carter thanks Hoffman for his efforts to obtain a copy of a report by the Yellow Fever Commission that is necessary to verify a reference.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick L. Hoffman, December 16, 1928

2122 California St. N. W.
Washington, D. C.
December 16, 1928.
Dr. Frederick L. Hoffman,
Consulting Statistician,
The Prudential Insurance Company of America,
Newark, N. Y.
Dear Doctor Hoffman:
div1.p:
Your very kind letter of December 14th. . with enclosed carbon
copy toof your letter to the Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine
has just reached me. I am extremely grateful to you for the in-
quiries you are making re the Third Investigator's Report (which I
am so anxious to see!) on the Non-Malarial Fevers of West Africa,
and which, I understand contains the results of Bacot's work on the
life history of “Stegomyia fasciata” from 1914 to 1916 (?) I am
also much your debtor for your assurance that you will get in touch
with me again as soon as you get a reply to your letter to the
Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine.

With heartfelt good wishes for Christmas and the New Year
to yourself and your family, who I hope remember me half as pleas-
antly as I do them.
div1.closer: Sincerely and gratefully yours, Laura A. Carter. LAC:FGB
